edu.lehigh.cse.lol

Class ProjectilePool

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.lehigh.cse.lol.ProjectilePool

  • public class ProjectilePool
extends java.lang.Object
    The ProjectilePool is the public interface to Projectiles. The programmer can't make individual projectiles, but can configure a pool of projectiles that can then be thrown by a hero.

    • Method Detail

      • setRange

        public static void setRange(float distance)
        Specify a limit on how far away from the Hero a projectile can go. Without this, projectiles could keep on traveling forever.
        Parameters:
        distance - Maximum distance from the hero that a projectile can travel

      • setProjectileGravityOn

        public static void setProjectileGravityOn()
        Indicate that projectiles should feel the effects of gravity. Otherwise, they will be (more or less) immune to gravitational forces.

      • setImageSource

        public static void setImageSource(java.lang.String imgName)
        Specify the image file from which to randomly choose projectile images
        Parameters:
        range - This number indicates the number of cells

      • setProjectileVectorDampeningFactor

        public static void setProjectileVectorDampeningFactor(float factor)
        The "vector projectile" mechanism might lead to the projectiles moving too fast. This will cause the speed to be multiplied by a factor
        Parameters:
        factor - The value to multiply against the projectile speed.

      • enableCollisionsForProjectiles

        public static void enableCollisionsForProjectiles()
        Indicate that all projectiles should participate in collisions, rather than disappearing when they collide with other entities

      • setFixedVectorThrowVelocity

        public static void setFixedVectorThrowVelocity(float velocity)
        Indicate that projectiles thrown with the "vector" mechanism should have a fixed velocity
        Parameters:
        velocity - The magnitude of the velocity for projectiles

      • setRotateVectorThrow

        public static void setRotateVectorThrow()
        Indicate that projectiles thrown via the "vector" mechanism should be rotated to face in their direction or movement

      • setCollisionOk

        public static void setCollisionOk()
        Indicate that when two projectiles collide, they should both remain on screen

      • configure

        public static void configure(int size,
             float width,
             float height,
             java.lang.String imgName,
             float velocityX,
             float velocityY,
             float offsetX,
             float offsetY,
             int strength,
             int zIndex,
             boolean isCircle)
        Describe the behavior of projectiles in a scene. You must call this if you intend to use projectiles in your scene.
        Parameters:
        size - number of projectiles that can be thrown at once
        width - width of a projectile
        height - height of a projectile
        imgName - image to use for projectiles
        velocityX - x velocity of projectiles
        velocityY - y velocity of projectiles
        offsetX - specifies the x distance between the bottom left of the projectile and the bottom left of the hero throwing the projectile
        offsetY - specifies the y distance between the bottom left of the projectile and the bottom left of the hero throwing the projectile
        strength - specifies the amount of damage that a projectile does to an enemy
        zIndex - The z plane on which the projectiles should be drawn
        isCircle - Should projectiles have an underlying circle or box shape?

      • setNumberOfProjectiles

        public static void setNumberOfProjectiles(int number)
        Set a limit on the total number of projectiles that can be thrown
        Parameters:
        number - How many projectiles are available

      • setThrowSound

        public static void setThrowSound(java.lang.String soundName)
        Specify a sound to play when the projectile is thrown
        Parameters:
        soundName - Name of the sound file to play

      • setProjectileDisappearSound

        public static void setProjectileDisappearSound(java.lang.String soundName)
        Specify the sound to play when a projectile disappears
        Parameters:
        soundName - the name of the sound file to play

      • setAnimation

        public static void setAnimation(Animation a)
        Specify how projectiles should be animated
        Parameters:
        frames - a listing of the order in which frames of the underlying image should be displayed
        durations - time to display each frame
